WorkItem.Description:
Getting some weird results when optimizing the tank dk.  It's reforging into crit / hit / expertise and parry stacking while ignoring dodge.  Results of my optimize attached
Â 
I optimized for mitigation with health requirement at 180,000 and mastery weighted as high as it can go.

Comments.Message:
Well, there's ya problem... Optimize to Mastery >= 9000
It can never succeed trying to make Mastery >= 9000.
Remember: The sub-optimize values are hard rules that the optimizer will try to match before it works on anything else.

ahh, didn't think it would just ignore everything else.  Thought it would try to get close as possible to the amount of mastery then finish optimizing everything else.  But even without any rules, just doing a normal optimize it seems to put everything into parry

That's not how those optimizer sub-points work since it wouldn't know what is "good enough." 
And while it looks like it's putting everything into parry, it's not quite that drastic.  There is a benefit to having more parry than dodge through some of the special effects and the stacking nature of avoidance.  Since you already have (presumably) 4% parry coming from the Runeforge, plus an additional 20% for 12 secs (more if you have 4t12) every 90 secs.  The diminishing returns at these numbers are not low enough to reduce the value of parry past dodge.
